recipe.recipe_name: Spinach and Mushroom Egg White Frittata
recipe.ingredients: - egg whites: 8 - fresh spinach: 3 cups - cremini mushrooms (sliced): 2 cups - cherry tomatoes (halved): 1 cup - low-fat feta cheese (crumbled): 1/2 cup - olive oil: 1 tablespoon - garlic (minced): 2 cloves - salt: 1/4 teaspoon - black pepper: 1/4 teaspoon - fresh basil (chopped, for garnish): 2 tablespoons
recipe.directions: 1. Preheat Oven: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C). 2. Sauté Vegetables: Heat olive oil in a large oven-proof skillet over medium heat. Add mushrooms and sauté for 5-7 minutes until they start to brown. Add garlic and spinach and cook until spinach is wilted, about 2-3 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. 3. Add Tomatoes: Stir in the cherry tomatoes and cook for an additional minute. 4. Pour Egg Whites: Spread the vegetables in an even layer and pour the egg whites over the top. Cook for 2-3 minutes until the eggs start to set. 5. Add Cheese: Sprinkle the crumbled feta cheese over the top of the frittata mixture. 6. Bake Frittata: Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for 15-18 minutes, or until the frittata is set and the top is lightly golden. 7. Garnish and Serve: Remove from oven and let it cool for a few minutes. Garnish with fresh basil before serving.
recipe.nutrition: Total Carbohydrate: 10g, Dietary Fiber: 2g, Sodium: 550mg, Saturated Fat: 3g, Total Fat: 5g, Protein: 18g, Added Sugars: 0g, Total Sugars: 4g
recipe.total_calories_estimation: - Total Calories for entire recipe : Approximately 400 calories for the entire recipe. - Calories for each ingredient (using USDA Food API where applicable): Egg Whites: 70 calories (from 8 egg whites) Fresh Spinach: 20 calories Cremini Mushrooms: 30 calories Cherry Tomatoes: 30 calories Low-fat Feta Cheese: 140 calories Olive Oil: 120 calories Garlic: Negligible Salt, Black Pepper: Negligible Fresh Basil: Negligible - Serving People: 4
